cache.size.label: Cache size:
cache.size.description: Number of URLs fetched and parsed before saving results (0=infinite).

db.timeout.decription: Timeout on mySQL query execution (in milliseconds).

newest.only.description: Parse only the newest content for each URL.

result.table.label: Result table:
result.table.description: Table name to save parsed fields to.

skip.label: Skip URLs:
skip.description: Queries on URLs that will not be parsed.

sleep.idle.description: Time (in ms) to wait before checking for new URLs when all URLs have been parsed.

sleep.mysql.description: Time (in s) to wait before last try to re-connect to mySQL server.

datetime.formats.label: Date/time formats:
datetime.formats.description: Format of the date/time to be parsed by the query with the same array index (default: '%F %T', see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

datetime.locales.label: Date/time locales:
datetime.locales.description: Locale used by the query of the same array index for parsing the date/time.

datetime.queries.label: Date/time queries:
datetime.queries.description: Queries used for parsing the date/time. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used.

datetime.sources.label: Date/time sources:
datetime.sources.description: Where to parse the date/time from.

datetime.warning.empty.description: Log warning if no date/time could be parsed although a query is specified (and logging is enabled).

field.datetime.formats.label: Field date/time formats:
field.datetime.formats.description: Date/time format of the field with the same array index (default: empty, i.e. no date/time conversion, see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

field.datetime.locales.label: Field date/time locales:
field.datetime.locales.description: Locale used when converting the field with the same array index to a date/time (ignored if no date/time format has been specified for the field).

field.delimiters.description: Delimiter between multiple results for the field with the same array index if not saved as JSON. Only the first character, \n (default), \t or \\ will be used.

field.ignore.empty.description: Ignore empty values when parsing multiple results for the field with the same array index (default).

field.json.label: Field results as JSON:
field.json.description: Save the value of the field with the same array index as a JSON array.

field.names.label: Field names:
field.names.description: The names of the custom fields to parse.

field.queries.label: Field queries:
field.queries.description: The query used to parse the custom field with the same array index.

field.sources.label: Field sources:
field.sources.description: Where to parse the custom field with the same array index from.

field.tidy.texts.label: Field results as tidied text:
field.tidy.texts.description: Remove line breaks and unnecessary spaces when parsing the field with the same array index.

field.warnings.empty.description: Log warning if the field with the same array index is empty (and logging is enabled).

id.queries.label: ID queries:
id.queries.description: Queries to parse the ID. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used. Pages with duplicate or empty IDs will not be parsed.

id.sources.label: ID sources:
id.sources.description: Where to parse the ID from when using the query with the same array index.

repair.cdata.description: Try to repair CData when parsing HTML/XML.

tidy.errors.description: Number  of tidyhtml errors to log (if logging is enabled).

tidy.warnings.description: Log tidyhtml warnings (if logging is enabled).
